question: What was the title given to the daughters of the Kings of Spain and Portugal who were not the heir to the throne?

cot.cot_output:
Reasoning process:
In the Spanish and Portuguese monarchies, the daughters of the kings who were not the heir to the throne were often given the title of "Infanta" in Spanish or "Infanta" in Portuguese. This title was used to denote a royal princess who was not the heir apparent.

Answer:
The title given to the daughters of the Kings of Spain and Portugal who were not the heir to the throne was "Infanta" in Spanish or "Infanta" in Portuguese.
